result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Brief in Opposition to Joinder; filed.

Attorney Allison Marie Ritter in court for Deandre L Johnson. Defendant Deandre L Johnson in court, in custody. Attorney Michael Christopher Schindhelm in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for Status Conference. Case tagging along with 22CF2499. State has filed a joinder motion. Parties request a hearing date. Case adjourned, Branch 38.
Motion hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD. Defense unavailable for hearing and request a new arraignment hearing. Parties notified of new date.

Defendant Deandre L Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Allison Marie Ritter in court for Deandre L Johnson.  Attorney Michael Christopher Schindhelm in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Status Conference held.  Court addresses Request for Substitution filed in Defendant's other pending matter by previous counsel.  State filed motion to join.  Court adjourns this matter with Defendant's substitution case.
Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Deandre L Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Christopher Schindhelm in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Case calendared for Status of Counsel this date.  Attorney Ritter unavailable and requests adjournment.
Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Retainer received and filed.  bm

Defendant Deandre L Johnson in court with attorney Benjamin T Van Severen.  Defendant Deandre L Johnson in custody.  Jennifer Tate for Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Case calendared for Further Proceedings this date.  Attorney Isaac no longer with Attorney Van Severen's firm.  Attorney Van Severen moves to allow the firm to withdraw.  Court grants request.  Defendant advises he may be retaining private counsel.  Status conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Deandre L Johnson in court with attorney Gregory W Isaac.  Defendant Deandre L Johnson in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for Bail/Bond Hearing.  Court Ordered Defendant to stay on LEVEL 5 SUPERVISION with Electronic Monitoring.  Case scheduled for Further Proceedings.  Further proceedings scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Bond Modification received and filed.  bm

Defendant Deandre L Johnson in court with Attorney Gregory W Isaac.  Defendant Deandre L Johnson in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective B. Maciejewski. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Branch 12.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Retainer received and filed.  bm

Adjustment Number: 22A 052605,
Payable Number: 1011152,
Receipt Number: 22RP022710,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Deandre L Johnson not in court, defendant in custody.  Annie Louk appeared in person by video for the State of Wisconsin.Case set for preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel.
Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with D.G.L.; S.B.L
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Deandre L Johnson in court with attorney Matt W Kline.  Defendant Deandre L Johnson in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deandre L Johnson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 7.   DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
